info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 24 at 9:30PM MDT until July 24 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM MDT FOR NORTHEASTERN PROWERS AND EASTERN KIOWA COUNTIES... At 929 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles north of Towner to 10 miles north of Hartman to near Coolidge, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. As reported, this storm has a history of producing widespread wind damage to structures and trees. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Holly, Granada, Sheridan Lake, Hartman, Towner, Bristol, Chivington and Brandon. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
